definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Come this way. My brother has a shop.
sentences.chinese: 跟我来，我兄弟有专营店。

sentences.english: There Weichai power franchise stores, China's heavy truck engines two franchise stores.
sentences.chinese: 另设潍柴动力专营店，中国重汽发动机专营店两个。

sentences.english: There Weichai power franchise stores, China's heavy truck engines two franchise stores.
sentences.chinese: 另设潍柴动力专营店，中国重汽发动机专营店两个。

sentences.english: The size of company grew rapidly, and immediately after WWII 450 franchises were opened.
sentences.chinese: 二战之后极快的发展了450家专营店。

sentences.english: Automobile Concession Shop is one of the Automobile Trade Buildings.
sentences.chinese: 独立式汽车品牌专营店是汽车贸易建筑的组成之一。

sentences.english: A liquor store clerk reads a magazine at the counter.
sentences.chinese: 一个酒类专营店的雇员在柜台上翻阅杂志。

sentences.english: R trademark application for Taobao Mall store margin of 100000.
sentences.chinese: 商标申请淘宝商城专营店保证金为10万。

sentences.english: You will find strip developments of franchise shops and housing plats spilling out over the edge of town.
sentences.chinese: 你会发现带发展专营店和住房树种泄露出城市的边缘。

sentences.english: This is also the case when considering the purchase of  jewelry items from specific outlets.
sentences.chinese: 当你考虑购买专营店的珠宝首饰时更是如此。

definition: to sell/to sell on commission/to distribute
brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
see 商城縣|商城县[Shang1 cheng2 xian4]
